message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "10:52:21.212 [LoadFile] file = \"foo/bar/baz.xml\"";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, "\"");
        st.nextToken();  // Skip the first token
        String filePath = st.nextToken();  // This will be the file path
        System.out.println(filePath);  // Prints: foo/bar/baz.xml
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In the provided code, we are using the StringTokenizer to break the string into tokens using the double quote (") as the delimiter. The first call to nextToken() will skip the first token (which is the part of the string before the file path). The second call to nextToken() will then return the file path.
